FuncDef:
The ptp alarm-threshold time-offset-sum command configures an alarm threshold for the peak value of the accumulated PTP source time offsets.
The undo ptp alarm-threshold time-offset-sum command restores the default configuration.
By default, the alarm threshold for the peak value of the accumulated PTP source time offsets is 500 ns.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the alarm threshold of the peak value of the accumulated time offsets.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1000000000, in ns.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A device of the BC/T-BC or OC slave type supports time offset accumulation and detection. If the peak value of the accumulated time offsets exceeds the threshold, an alarm will be reported. The peak value of the accumulated time offsets is the difference between the maximum and minimum time offsets within a specified period.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
